data.title: List Of Dadasaheb Phalke Award Winners From Last Ten Years
meta_keywords: Dadasaheb Phalke winners of past ten years
data.meta_description: The Dadasaheb Phalke Award, named after the 'Father of Indian Cinema', is the highest honour in the Indian film industry. The prestigious award has been recognising outstanding contributions to films since 1969. Due to the pandemic, the awards were delayed by two years. As a result, Waheeda Rehman was announced as the winner in 2021 and received the award only recently. Here, we present a list of the winners from the past 10 years!
data.text:
Waheeda Rehman

Waheeda Rehman is the latest Bollywood actress to be honoured with the prestigious Dadasaheb Phalke Award. She was announced as the winner in 2021, but received the award two years later due to the pandemic.

Asha Parekh

Also honoured with the Padma Shri in 1992, this Hindi film industry actress was announced as the winner in 2020 and received the award in 2022.

Rajnikanth

Again, due to the pandemic, the renowned superstar was declared the winner in 2019, but received the award in 2021.

Amitabh Bachchan

In 2018, the esteemed Hindi cinema actor received the Dadasaheb Phalke Award for his outstanding contribution to the world of cinema.

Vinod Khanna

Khanna received the award in 2017. He is primarily known for acting in Hindi films during the 1970s.

Kasinadhuni Viswanath

He was honoured with the award in 2016 for his outstanding direction in Telugu films. Starting his career as a sound recordist, he went on to direct 53 feature films spanning various genres.

Manoj Kumar

Known for his image as a patriotic hero, Manoj Kumar made his acting debut in 1957 with the Hindi film, ‘Fashion’. He won the award in 2015.

Shashi Kapoor

Kapoor received the Dadasaheb Phalke Award in 2014, following his two National Film Awards, one of which was for Best Actor for his role in ‘New Delhi Times’ in 1985.

Gulzar

Gulzar, the renowned Indian poet and filmmaker known for his successful collaborations with music directors R. D. Burman and A. R. Rahman, received this award in 2013.
